attributes.action: … to fund Investigation into the causes and prevention of Dementia, and Research to discover new drugs and treatments to avert the onset of Dementia with timely diagnosis.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The burden of care for these victims falls on the NHS, local authorities and unpaid family members, many of whom have their own illnesses and disabilities.
This extract from a BBC News report explains the problem: “Researchers from Oxford University compared the cost of caring for a person with dementia to the cost of dealing with cancer, heart disease or stroke - the three main causes of death in the UK. Each dementia patient, they found, costs the economy £27,647 each year - nearly five times more than a cancer patient and eight times more than those with heart disease. 
With £600m a year, cancer research funding was 12 x the £50m devoted to dementia, while heart disease received 3 times as much. Only stroke research received less. Calculations showed that for every cancer patient, £295 is spent on research, compared with just £61 for each person with dementia.”
My own father-in-law died as a result of dementia after three years of mental and physical degradation. He was cared for 1 hour a day by two professional carers required to overcome his verbal and physical violence - and for most of the other 23 hours by his 82-year-old wife with occasional family support.
